intro: Iryanthera polyneura, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a tropical tree native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and aromatic properties. The plant has elliptical, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. Due to its valuable wood, it is also known for its ecological and economic importance in its native habitat.
